title: Threats to BLOs during SIR unacceptable: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has mandated all states to provide robust security for booth-level officers during voter enumeration, warning of severe action against any threats or obstructions. The court emphasized that non-cooperation with the Election Commission's work is a serious matter, extending beyond West Bengal to all states, and stressed the need for BLOs' safety to prevent anarchy.

title: Trump's rice tariffs threat unlikely to have severe impact on exports
content: US President Trump's threat of new rice tariffs is unlikely to significantly impact India, as exports to the US are a small fraction of global sales and already face high duties. Experts suggest this is a negotiation tactic amid ongoing trade deal talks, with India aiming to lift existing US tariffs.

title: PNB bank scam: Belgium court rejects Choksi's plea; 'extradition to begin soon'
content: Belgium's Supreme Court has rejected Mehul Choksi's final appeal, allowing his extradition to India to proceed. The Antwerp Court of Appeal's earlier decision, clearing his extradition for the PNB fraud case, now stands. Choksi's claims of political motivation and forced removal were dismissed, with assurances of his welfare in Indian custody.

title: Technology company CEOs caught smuggling Nvidia GPUs worth $160m to China
content: US authorities have busted a major smuggling ring exporting over $160 million in advanced Nvidia AI chips to China. Operation Gatekeeper revealed a scheme using fake documents and shell companies. Executives face charges for illegally shipping high-end GPUs, crucial for AI and potentially military use, to restricted destinations. Several arrests and guilty pleas have been made.

title: After Putin, PM Modi to host German chancellor Merz
content: India is boosting its European ties, with German Chancellor Friedrich Merz set to visit New Delhi soon. This engagement follows President Putin's visit and precedes the India-EU summit. Discussions will focus on trade, technology, and sustainable development, building on existing partnerships. Germany's support for Ukraine and shared concerns over the Indo-Pacific will also be key topics.

title: NIA arrests another J&K doctor in Delhi car blast case
content: A doctor from Baramulla has been arrested as the eighth suspect in the November 10 Delhi car blast, which claimed 15 lives. The NIA identified him as a co-conspirator who allegedly provided support to the suicide bomber. This arrest is part of a larger investigation into a Jaish-e-Mohammed terror module involving professionals.

title: Hardik Pandya powers India to 101-run rout, SA bowled out for lowest T20I score ever
content: India began their T20 World Cup 2026 preparations with a dominant 101-run victory over South Africa. Hardik Pandya starred with an all-round performance. India's bowlers were disciplined, restricting South Africa to their lowest T20I total. The win gives India a 1-0 lead in the series. The next match is in New Chandigarh.

title: Sam Altman says industry is wrong on OpenAI's competition, it is not from Google, but ...
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has declared Apple its ultimate rival, shifting focus from AGI to device-centric AI.  A 'code red' memo halts moonshot projects to boost ChatGPT's performance, driven by aggressive talent raids from Apple.  Meanwhile, Google's Gemini surges, forcing OpenAI to prioritize mass-market appeal and user feedback to regain dominance.

title: PIO nurse sentenced to jail in UK for raping and assaulting colleagues in care home
content: An Indian-origin nurse, Naijil Paul, has been sentenced to over seven years in jail in Scotland for raping a colleague and sexually assaulting two others. Paul fled to India before his 2019 trial but was extradited after six years. He pleaded guilty to the charges, which occurred in 2018 while he managed Acorn Park Care Home in Glasgow.

title: Anthony Richardson injury update: Colts reveal QBâ€™s status for Seahawks game
content: Indianapolis Colts star Anthony Richardson is still recovering from an eye injury. Head coach Shane Steichen confirmed Richardson will not play this week. The player is resting his orbital bone fracture. Doctors and trainers must clear him for activation. The Colts face challenges with other player injuries and recent losses.

title: PM Modi-led committee, also including Rahul, meets today to pick next CIC
content: A crucial meeting is scheduled for Wednesday afternoon, with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and opposition leader in Lok Sabha Rahul Gandhi set to select the next Chief Information Commissioner and other Information Commissioners. The Central Information Commission has been operating with a significantly reduced staff since September, with eight commissioner posts vacant. This selection process is vital for the functioning of the CIC.

title: After $70bn loss, Zuckerberg signals his biggest bet is 'not working'
content: Meta is reportedly planning significant budget cuts for its Metaverse division, potentially slashing its Reality Labs budget by up to 30%. This move comes after the company has incurred over $70 billion in losses from its metaverse ambitions. The decision reflects a broader lack of consumer interest and a strategic pivot towards artificial intelligence.

title: IndiGo crisis: Govt doubles flight cuts to 10%; airline to submit revised schedule
content: Aviation authorities have slashed IndiGo's winter flight schedule by 10% following widespread passenger disruptions. The airline, which previously faced a 5% cut, will now operate significantly fewer flights due to internal mismanagement of crew rosters and inadequate communication. This move aims to stabilize operations and reduce cancellations, with IndiGo submitting a revised schedule soon.

title: Trey Benson injury update: Insider hints at setback as Cardinals stay quiet
content: Arizona Cardinals' star player Trey Benson faces a critical deadline for his return after a meniscus injury. NFL insider Adam Schefter suggests his season could end if not activated this week. Coach Jonathan Gannon remains uncertain about his comeback, leaving fans anxious as the struggling team faces the Houston Texans.

title: Inside George Springerâ€™s fairytale life with his wife Charlise Castro
content: Charlise Castro, a former Division I softball standout and America East Player of the Year, forged her own path beyond being George Springer's wife. After excelling in athletics, she pursued an MBA and built a credible career in wellness coaching, demonstrating ambition and resilience. Her journey highlights how partners of elite athletes can cultivate independent identities and success.

title: Ayesha Curry admits feeling anger when women try to pursue Stephen Curry
content: Ayesha Curry revealed on 'Red Table Talk' that she sometimes feels the urge to confront women who approach her husband, Stephen Curry, due to his naturally friendly demeanor. She later expressed regret about her appearance on the show, attributing the backlash to the platform's chaotic nature and the misinterpretation of her words.

title: Anna Kournikova & Enrique Iglesias 2025 net worth: Career, music and business
content: Tennis star Anna Kournikova and music icon Enrique Iglesias boast a combined net worth of $160 million in 2025. While Kournikova's fame transcended her $4 million prize money through lucrative endorsements, Iglesias' wealth stems from over 130 million record sales and global tours. Both have strategically invested in Miami real estate, contributing to their substantial shared fortune.

title: J&K directs govt medical colleges to increase MBBS intake
content: Jammu and Kashmir government has directed all five government medical colleges to increase MBBS seats, with Baramulla, Doda, and Kathua receiving 50 additional seats each, and Srinagar and Jammu adding 20 each. Principals are also urged to apply for more seats and strengthen super-specialty care, with SKIMS planning to seek around 130 postgraduate and 50 undergraduate seats.

title: Madrassa teacher held for raping minor in J&Kâ€™s Doda
content: A madrassa teacher has been arrested in Doda, Jammu and Kashmir, for allegedly raping a minor. Police apprehended the accused within three hours of the complaint, booking him under the Pocso Act and BNS. The swift arrest followed intelligence inputs and effective teamwork, with further investigation ongoing.

title: Vendors stop cardiac supplies to Jammu hospital over unpaid dues; HC takes note of crisis
content: The Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh High Court has taken suo motu notice of a two-day paralysis in cardiac care services at Govt Super Speciality Hospital, Jammu. This occurred after vendors halted supplies of emergency cardiac devices due to unpaid dues of nearly Rs 30 crore under the Ayushman Bharat scheme, putting vulnerable patients at risk.

title: Rupee at 90 per US dollar: What is RBI doing to defend it? â€˜Sell $100m every minuteâ€™!
content: The Indian rupee is experiencing significant pressure, hitting record lows against the US dollar due to trade deficits, US tariffs, and capital outflows. The Reserve Bank of India is reportedly employing a sophisticated, unpredictable intervention strategy, communicating confidential directives to dealers to manage volatility without depleting reserves or hindering growth. This approach aims to curb speculation while maintaining market stability.

title: Marvin Harrison Jr injury update: Heel issue puts Week 15 return in doubt
content: Marvin Harrison Jr.'s rookie season faces another hurdle with a heel issue, sidelining him for Week 14 and making his Week 15 availability uncertain.  With the Cardinals out of playoff contention, they are unlikely to rush him back. Michael Wilson has stepped up significantly in Harrison's absence, capitalizing on increased opportunities and becoming a key offensive contributor.

title: Canadaâ€™s C$1.7-bn research push targets global talent: Why Indian researchers should pay attention
content: Canada is rolling out a C$1.7-billion research funding push as uncertainty grips US campuses under shifting education policies. With fast-tracked visas and exemptions for doctoral students, Canadian universities are courting global talent. For Indian PhDs and postdocs, the move signals a shift in North Americaâ€™s academic landscape â€” from prestige alone to stability and predictability.

title: 'Gold medallist engineer': How Goa tragedy eclipsed Luthra brother' success; now absconding
content: Brothers Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra's rapid expansion of their Romeo Lane brand, fueled by a successful Goa outlet, has hit a tragic snag. Following a fatal incident at their 'island bar,' questions are mounting over safety clearances and operational oversight. Franchisees express disillusionment, and the brand faces an uncertain future amid industry calls for accountability.

title: Mega investment: Nadella meets PM; Microsoft commits record $17.5bn for India's AI future
content: Microsoft is investing $17.5 billion in India, its largest investment in Asia, to bolster the nation's digital infrastructure and AI capabilities. CEO Satya Nadella announced the commitment following a discussion with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, aiming to support India's "AI first future" by developing essential infrastructure, skills, and sovereign capabilities.

title: SIP boom vs debt surge: Is Indiaâ€™s middle class getting richer or trapped?
content: India's middle class is embracing SIPs, with record contributions flowing into mutual funds. However, this financial sophistication masks a growing reliance on debt, as liabilities outpace asset growth. Many families are using credit to fund lifestyles and investments, creating a fragile financial situation despite the SIP boom.

title: Is Leon Draisaitl playing tonight vs Sabres? Latest Dec 9 update
content: Edmonton Oilers' star Leon Draisaitl is confirmed to play tonight against the Buffalo Sabres, a crucial boost for the team's December momentum. Draisaitl, averaging over a point per game, remains a cornerstone of Edmonton's offense, vital for their home-ice advantage and pursuit of a key victory. His presence is expected to significantly impact the game's outcome.

title: Shocking stat: Why flying a passenger earns less than selling an iPhone cover, IATA explains
content: Airlines are projected to earn a meager $7.90 per passenger in 2026, a profit margin so low that Apple makes more selling an iPhone cover. Despite connecting economies and supporting millions of jobs, the aviation industry faces persistent headwinds like supply chain issues and delivery delays, capping profitability.

title: Drake Londonâ€™s Week 15 status: Day-to-day or done for 2025?
content: Drake London has missed three straight games with a PCL sprain and opened Week 15 as a non-participant on Atlantaâ€™s injury report. With the Falcons on a short week and already out of playoff contention, Londonâ€™s chances of returning against the Buccaneers look slim. Hereâ€™s the latest timeline, reporting, and what it means for Atlanta and fantasy managers.

title: Pandya power: Hardik becomes 4th Indian to achieve this feat; joins Ro-Ko in elite list
content: Hardik Pandya made a triumphant return to cricket after a 74-day layoff, smashing an unbeaten 59 off 28 balls against South Africa. His explosive innings, featuring six fours and four sixes, propelled India to 175/6. Pandya also achieved a significant milestone, becoming the fourth Indian to hit 100 T20I sixes.

title: Dark side of the universe: Why black holes still pull us in
content: Black holes, born from dying stars, are cosmic giants that grow by consuming matter and merging with others. While invisible themselves, their feeding frenzy creates brilliant light. Despite their fearsome reputation and potential for spaghettification, these celestial bodies pose no threat to Earth and play a crucial role in shaping galaxies, revealing the universe's underlying patterns.

title: Historic! Another milestone for Messi: Argentina legend becomes first ever to ...
content: Lionel Messi has made MLS history by winning the MVP award for the second consecutive year, solidifying his status as a dominant force. Despite playing in only half the games, his remarkable performance of 29 goals and 19 assists led the league. Messi's commitment and unique talent have earned him widespread admiration and a clear-cut victory in this year's voting.

title: 'Had a disc bulge': Gill reveals neck injury details after return
content: Shubman Gill detailed his recovery from a neck injury, a disc bulge that impacted his nerves, which forced him out of action for nearly a month. After rehabilitation at the BCCI Centre of Excellence, Gill has been cleared and rejoined the Indian squad for the T20I series.

title: 'Years of experience but still lost my job,â€™ shares employee: 5 ways to bounce back
content: Losing a job, especially early in a career, can be devastating, impacting more than just finances. A young professional's Reddit post highlights severe depression and a shattered sense of direction after a layoff. The article offers five practical strategies for navigating this disruption, including skill assessment, mentorship, and prioritizing mental well-being to regain career momentum.

title: Goa club fire: Portion of beach shack owned by Luthra brothers razed - watch
content: Days after a devastating fire at Birch by Romeo Lane claimed 25 lives, authorities demolished a section of the Romeo Lane restaurant in Goa's Vagator area. The structure, owned by Gaurav and Saurabh Luthra, was found to have encroached on the beach. Officials confirmed a 198-square-meter area was cleared.

title: 'Choose any day Samson over him': Gill fails on return; fans target 'poster boy'
content: Shubman Gill returned from injury but was out for just four runs in the first T20I against South Africa. He was dismissed early in the match. This performance drew criticism on social media. Gill had recovered from a neck injury. South Africa won the toss and chose to bowl.

title: 'Vote chori biggest anti-national act': Rahul in Lok Sabha during SIR debate; slams RSS
content: Rahul Gandhi accused the Election Commission of India of colluding with the BJP to rig elections, calling "vote chori" the biggest anti-national act. He questioned the removal of the CJI from the EC selection panel and alleged the RSS is capturing national institutions, including intelligence agencies and investigative bodies, to suppress opposition.

title: Goa club fire: Owner Gaurav Luthra spotted at Thailand airport; 1st image out
content: Goa nightclub owners, Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, have fled to Thailand following a devastating fire that killed 25 people. Authorities issued a Look Out Circular and are coordinating with Interpol for their arrest.  Meanwhile, a third individual, Bharat Kohli, has been apprehended in Delhi and handed over to Goa police.

title: Smriti Mandhana updates Insta bio after wedding with Palash called off
content: Cricketer Smriti Mandhana confirmed her wedding to music composer Palash Muchhal has been called off, urging an end to speculation. Muchhal also stated he has "decided to move on" and warned of legal action against rumour-mongers. Mandhana emphasized her focus remains on representing India in cricket.

title: 'IndiGo back on its feet': CEO says ops stable; airline focusing on what led to crisis
content: IndiGo CEO Pieter Elbers assures operations are stabilizing after a recent crisis, with refunds issued and flights restored to all 138 destinations. The Civil Aviation Minister holds IndiGo accountable, emphasizing passenger convenience. The DGCA has mandated a 5% cut in IndiGo's winter schedule due to operational inefficiencies, with further reductions possible as the airline works to stabilize.

title: Dick Van Dyke reveals daily habits and lifestyle secrets to live beyond 100
content: Iconic entertainer Dick Van Dyke, nearing 100, shares his secrets to a vibrant life. His regimen includes daily exercise, yoga, and a playful spirit.  Van Dyke emphasizes embracing new experiences, maintaining strong social bonds, and crucially, abstaining from alcohol and cigarettes.  His optimistic outlook fuels his remarkable longevity and active engagement with the world.

title: Shamiâ€™s India snub: Ganguly questions Agarkar - 'Don't see any reason'
content: Mohammed Shami's stellar domestic form, bagging 11 wickets in three matches, sparks debate over his national team exclusion. Former BCCI chief Sourav Ganguly questions the selectors' decision, citing Shami's immense skill. Despite injury setbacks post-World Cup, the veteran pacer's experience could bolster India's bowling attack, especially in ODIs, ensuring a smooth transition.

title: Gill, Sudarshan, and gaps around them: What puzzles must GT solve at auction
content: With only 5 wins in 14 matches and a win percentage of 41.7, the 2024 season was a disaster for the Gujarat Titans as they finished 8th in the point table. However, GT had a good season last year after the mega auction and qualified for the playoffs, but were defeated in the Eliminator by the Mumbai Indians (MI).

title: Peralta to Red Sox? Greene to Dodgers? Best fits for top potential pitching trade candidates
content: A number of teams have the need -- and means -- to trade for a starting pitcher this winter. Here's how they match up with available hurlers.

title: MLB winter meetings updates, rumors: What will follow huge deals for Diaz, Schwarber?
content: Here's everything you need from Orlando as big signings by the Dodgers and Phillies rock the winter meetings.

title: Sources: QB Rivers unretiring to sign with Colts
content: Philip Rivers, who has not played in the NFL since 2020, is signing to the Colts' practice squad, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Tuesday.

title: Sources: Schwarber back to Phils on $150M deal
content: Slugger Kyle Schwarber, who led the NL with 56 home runs last season, and the Phillies are finalizing a five-year, $150 million contract, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: Dodgers, closer Diaz reach $69M deal
content: The Dodgers got the best closer on the free agent market, reaching a three-year, $69 million deal with former Mets reliever Edwin Diaz, sources told ESPN.

title: Irish will push to keep Freeman amid NFL interest
content: Notre Dame athletic director Pete Bevacqua acknowledged potential NFL interest in Marcus Freeman, saying he will push to make him one of college football's highest-paid coaches.

title: Bronx man charged in shooting of Jets' Boyd
content: A 20-year-old Bronx man has been arrested and charged with attempted murder in the November shooting of New York Jets player Kris Boyd.

title: AD: ACC social media campaign 'targeted' Irish
content: Notre Dame AD Pete Bevacqua says the ACC engaged in a "targeted" social media campaign against the school's football team for College Football Playoff consideration.

title: Tomlin: Metcalf shouldn't miss Dolphins game
content: Steelers coach Mike Tomlin said Tuesday he doesn't anticipate wide receiver DK Metcalf's availability for Monday's game against the Miami Dolphins (6-7) to be "jeopardized" by his hospital visit and overnight stay in Baltimore after Sunday's win.

title: Messi voted MLS MVP for second straight year
content: Inter Miami captain Lionel Messi has been voted the 2025 MLS MVP, becoming the first player in league history to win the award in two consecutive seasons.

title: ðŸ‘€ What Shams is hearing on NBA trade season
content: As NBA trade season nears, the futures of Anthony Davis and Giannis Antetokounmpo are in focus. Here's everything we're hearing.

title: Solak's second look at Week 14: We're fixing the Chiefs' biggest issues and sorting AFC South chaos
content: Ben Solak lays out ways to improve the Chiefs' struggling offense, makes his case for the Jaguars' legitimacy and more.

content: We unveil our latest rankings and also look at the most surprising statistical rankings for each team.

content: Can the Huskies hold off the Gators in a battle of recent national champions? Here are the keys to their game, as well as the Cougars' matchup vs. the Tigers.

title: Men's Bracketology: Iowa State replaces Purdue as a 1-seed
content: In knocking off former 1-seed Purdue, unbeaten Iowa State changed its trajectory and is now on the top line.

content: Everyone wants to know: which teams are in the group of death for the 2026 World Cup? Well, the "group of death" may be officially dead.

content: Weekly individual and composite rankings for each position in PPR and IDP formats, as well as Eric Karabell's superflex ranks.

content: A growing number of athletic directors say they are interested in exploring a once-unthinkable option.

content: Bill Connelly breaks down the path to victory for every team -- and what will hold each of them back.

title: Jameis Winston trolls Florida State football, praises women's soccer champs
content: The former Seminoles quarterback was excited about the Florida State's women's soccer team's fifth title ... and less than impressed by his old squad.

title: WWE 'Raw' takeaways: Does Bron Breakker really want the 'old CM Punk'?
content: Bron Breakker's callout of CM Punk and Gunther's vow to make John Cena give up highlight Monday night's "Raw."

content: O'Shaquie Foster was dominant against Stephen Fulton, earning higher ranking. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

content: Week 14 "set the tone" for many NFL teams as Super Bowl favorites faltered and underdogs picked up steam.

content: What lines offered value once odds came out? Here are five games we're eyeing for bets going into Week 15.

content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: UFC 323 fight grades: Why Dvalishvili-Yan wasn't the best fight on the card
content: Which fights were the best and worst of the last UFC PPV of 2025? Andreas Hale grades every fight from UFC 323.

title: Lando Norris isn't an F1 'badass.' His vulnerability makes him a unique champion
content: In a sport where athletes are expected to be "badass," newly crowned F1 champion Lando Norris' openness to talking about his emotions is a rarity.

title: No deaths due to air pollution, Centre tells Rajya Sabha
content: Health effects of air pollution are a synergistic manifestation of factors which include food habits, occupational habits, socio-economic status, medical history, immunity, heredity, etc. of the individuals, says Minister of State for Health Prataprao Jadhav

title: A deep cleaning of Indiaâ€™s electoral rolls
content: The revision and verification of electoral rolls is a routine and necessary process. Such corrections do not, by themselves, imply disenfranchisement or targeting

title: CM Revanth to visit Osmania University on Dec.10
content: The visit carries symbolic weight, coinciding with the 16th anniversary of the announcement to carve out Telangana as a separate State, on December 9, 2009

title: India, Brunei hold inaugural defence JWG meet
content: Key areas of discussion include the expansion of military-to-military exchanges, joint training and enhanced maritime security cooperation

title: Leh body seeks public input on fresh draft proposal for MHA on issues faced by Ladakh
content: The LAB seeks transparency and inclusive participation, rather than just social media comments, says its member, Mustafa Haji

title: Watch: Rahul Gandhi questions EC, slams RSS, warns of threat to democracy in Lok Sabha
content: Rahul Gandhi delivered a blistering speech in the Lok Sabha during the election reforms debate, accusing the government and the Election Commission of institutional capture, raising concerns over â€œvote chori,â€ and questioning changes to key electoral laws. He also criticised the RSS, celebrated Indiaâ€™s democratic spirit, and proposed urgent reforms to protect free and fair elections.

title: IndiGo flight cuts to spike airfares in peak season, leave passengers with few options
content: Back-of-the-envelope calculations indicate that reducing daily flights from 400 to 500 will affect 65,000 to 81,000 daily passengers, who had probably booked their seats weeks in advance

title: Land for integrated check-posts in West Bengal in different stagesÂ of acquisition: MHA
content: The West Bengal Government accorded approval for land acquisition only on November 21, 2023, and the Central Government has made the requisite payment to the State, Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai said in a written reply to the Lok Sabha

title: BJP committing vote chori in collusion with Election Commission, says Rahul
content: The Congress leader claimed that the Modi government changed the law to give complete immunity to election commissioners for their decision but added, â€œwe are going to change the law and going to find youâ€

title: Telanganaâ€™s EODB measures, infrastructure, talent come for praise
content: A senior official of the Industries Department urged entrepreneurs to make most of the measures, while refraining from incentive shopping

title: India has to move from service provider to a product nation by exploring energies technologies: Ashwini Vaishnaw
content: Indiaâ€™s maiden full-fledged summit on supercomputing kicks-off in Yelahanka. The five day event being held at Manipal Institute of Technology campus features advanced computer technologies by 175 firms.

title: Debate on Vande Mataram an attempt to divert attention from economic issues: Opposition
content: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge said Parliament can pay true homage to Bharat Mata by discussing and resolving the issues of common people

title: Donâ€™t sanction Eklavya schools until land already acquired: House panel tells govt.
content: Parliamentary Standing Committee on Social Justice and Empowerment notes that out of 722 sanctioned Eklavya schools for tribal students, 477 are functional, of which 341 are running from their own buildings and the rest operating in rented premises or other government buildings

content: â€œLetÂ me remind the officials concerned that their duty is to enforce the law and not go by dictates that are often issued orally...  I have already ordered notice in the contempt petition. It is beyond dispute that the order of this court has been breached repeatedly,â€ says Justice G.R. Swaminathan

title: Watch: IndiGo cuts 400â€“500 flights amid DGCA orders to â€œstabiliseâ€ operations
content: The decision comes hours after the DGCA ordered a 5% reduction, citing the airlineâ€™s inability to operate its full approved schedule reliably

title: SIR is not new; several have taken place since 1952, Law Minister tells LS
content: Accuses Congress of â€˜vote choriâ€™ in first LS poll; JD(U)â€™s Rajeev Ranjan Singh asks why Opposition parties only question EVMs when they lose elections; NCP (SP)â€™s Supriya Sule says ECI appears to be part of government

title: Zelensky Says Ready To Hold Ukraine Elections
content: President Volodymyr Zelensky said on Tuesday he was 'ready' for elections, after his US counterpart Donald Trump questioned whether Ukraine was democratic for not holding elections during the war.

title: 'Shahjehan' Returns: Air India's Boeing 747 Model Greets UNESCO Delegates
content: Delhi's historic Red Fort is hosting the ongoing key meeting of UNESCO on safeguarding intangible cultural heritage, and fittingly, 'Shahjehan' has 'returned' to the Mughal-era palace complex to greet the delegates.

title: 4 Arrested For Duping Cancer Patient Of Rs 1.3 Lakh In Insurance Fraud In Delhi
content: Four cyber fraudsters have been arrested for allegedly duping a cancer patient of Rs 1.30 lakh in an insurance fraud, police said on Tuesday.

title: Zelensky Says Will Send US Revised Plan To End Ukraine War
content: President Volodymyr Zelensky on Tuesday said he planned to send the United States revised proposals "in the near future" on ending Russia's war on Ukraine, after meeting with European allies to strategize on their next steps.

title: "Investments Will Come Soon": Gautam Adani In Dhanbad
content: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani on Tuesday said that Jharkhand -- particularly Dhanbad -- holds significant potential, and the state is poised for strong growth in the coming years.

title: What's My Age Again? The Tech Behind Australia's Social Media Ban
content: Tech giants will apply multiple layers of security to weed out young users under Australia's world-first ban on social media for under-16s.

title: Nobel Event Cancellation Raises Questions Over Maria Machado's Whereabouts
content: Nobel officials cancelled a press conference with Peace Prize laureate Maria Corina Machado in Oslo Tuesday, as it was unclear where the Venezuelan opposition leader was and whether she would collect her award in person.

title: Keen To Deepen Ties With India In Defence, Energy: US Official
content: Translating the vision enunciated by Donald Trump and PM Modi in their meeting into "concrete progress" was the focus of talks on Tuesday between US Under Secretary of State for Political Affairs Allison Hooker and Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri.

title: Trump Says Court Blocking Tariffs Would Be 'Biggest' Security Threat
content: US President Donald Trump warned on Tuesday that a potential Supreme Court ruling against his power to apply tariffs would threaten national security.

title: To Get Foreign Funds, Outfit Said Students Were Sexually Abused: Probe Agency
content: A Hyderabad-based education outfit has allegedly been found to be misappropriating RTE funds, getting foreign donations by misrepresenting ordinary students as 'joginis' and diverting funds for extravagant foreign travels, the ED said on Tuesday.

title: In Madurai Temple Lamp Row, Court Summons Tamil Nadu Top Official, Cop
content: The Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court on Tuesday directed Tamil Nadu Chief Secretary and Additional Director-General of Police (Law and Order) to appear before the court through video conference on December 17 in the temple lamp case.

title: Trump Okays Nvidia H200 Sales To China: How Domestic AI Chips Compare
content: US President Donald Trump said the United States would allow Nvidia's H200 processors to be exported to China, though it remains unclear whether Beijing will give the green light to Chinese companies to purchase them.

title: NDA Pushes For Return Of OPS, TTV Dhinakaran. All Eyes Now On Palaniswami
content: Ahead of a crucial AIADMK Executive Committee meeting on Wednesday, intense speculation is swirling within the party and the NDA over the possible return of expelled AIADMK leaders O Panneerselvam (OPS) and TTV Dhinakaran to NDA .

title: Gautam Adani Inaugurates Vocational Training For Differently Abled In Dhanbad
content: Adani Group Chairman and Founder Gautam Adani on Tuesday inaugurated vocational training for differently abled and a cloud kitchen in Dhanbad, Jharkhand.

title: Apple Phone Case Profits Could Top Airline Flyer Revenue: Aviation Body Chief
content: Apple will earn more by selling an iPhone cover than the USD 7.90 profit per passenger that airlines will make next year, IATA chief Willie Walsh said on Tuesday, as he highlighted that industry-level margins remain a pittance.

title: Apples, Handwash Stolen From Pakistan Judge's Chamber, FIR Filed
content: Pakistan's Punjab province police registered an FIR over theft of "two apples and a hand wash bottle" from the chamber of a sessions court judge in Lahore city, police said on Tuesday.

title: Microsoft, Intel, Cognizant: Tech CEOs Meet PM Modi Over India Expansion
content: Tech leaders, including Cognizant's Chief Executive Officer (CEO) Ravi Kumar S, Intel's CEO Lip-Bu Tan, and Microsoft Chairman and CEO Satya Nadella, met Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday

title: Amid High Pollution, Delhi Bans Coal, Firewood In All Restaurant Tandoors
content: Amid high pollution levels in the capital, the Delhi Pollution Control Committee (DPCC) has issued directions mandating a strict ban on the use of coal and firewood in tandoors across all hotels, restaurants and open eateries in the city.

title: Assam Air Force Station To Hold Air Show To Celebrate 54 Years Of 1971 War Victory
content: The Indian Air Force will commemorate the 1971 war victory with an aerial display at Air Force Station in Mohanbari in Assam's Dibrugarh on Wednesday as part of the Vijay Diwas Celebration.

title: Survivor Approaches Panchayat For Justice, Members Call Rapists 'Sanskari'
content: Gang-raped by six men, a tribal woman in Madhya Pradesh's Khandwa sought justice from her community panchayat, only to find that not only did several members try to suppress the matter, they also called her rapists 'sanskari'.

title: Madras High Court permits Tiruppur Corporation to establish temporary waste storage site at Iduvai
content: Justice V. Lakshminarayanan expresses dismay over the Corporation having been dumping its waste in abandoned quarries for years together

title: Left parties slam bid to stoke communal tensions in Tamil Nadu
content: Joint statement accuses BJP of manufacturing controversy over Thirupparankundram Hill; urges people to uphold harmony

title: Speeches alone cannot attract UAPA charges, say Delhi riots accused
content: Defence argues speeches, however unpalatable, do not amount to criminal conspiracy; court to hear closing submissions

title: Your answers to the practical difficulties of electors are mechanical, cyclostyled: Supreme Court slams Election Commission
content: EC offers statistics in response to pleas for extension of deadlines by migrant workers in T.N., students in Kerala; SC says EC must protect BLOs along with States; EC blames hostile political parties for BLOsâ€™ stress

title: Mamata tears up Centreâ€™s note imposing conditions on MGNREGA resumption in WB
content: â€œDonâ€™t want your mercy,â€ says CM, rejecting conditions of an immediate labour budget, training; says State will expand its own Karmashree scheme instead; MGNREGA has been suspended in WB since March 2022

title: Watch: Manish Tewari questions Election Commissionâ€™s impartiality, calls for major reforms
content: Manish Tewari raises serious questions about the Election Commissionâ€™s impartiality and calls for major reforms in the selection process. He highlights concerns over EVM manipulation, advocates 100% VVPAT counting, and even suggests returning to paper ballots to restore public trust in democracy.

title: Ernakulam records 74.59% voter turnout in local body polls
content: The polling percentage surpassed the 2020 figure of 72.49% with municipalities recording 75.09% and tri-level panchayats 77.14% voter turnout

title: Vibrant â€˜Kottikalasamâ€™ marks conclusion of hectic campaigning in Kannur, Kasaragod
content: WithÂ KannurÂ remaining largely peaceful under heavy police deployment due to past tensions, â€˜kottikalasamâ€™ peak satÂ KanhangadÂ inÂ Kasaragod, where all three fronts are expected to face a close contest in the local body elections

title: Trade unions plan February general strike against Labour Codes
content: Ten central trade unions say Labour Codes must be withdrawn and prepare nationwide action aligned with wider protests

title: UDF rushing to offer clean chit to Jamaat-e-Islami, says Kerala CM
content: Pinarayi Vijayan alleges that the UDF is ready to align with organisations that have never been part of mainstream fronts, including those taking â€œcommunal extremist positionsâ€

title: Major fronts make last-ditch efforts to woo voters in Kozhikode
content: While the UDF focussed on the gold theft case at Sabarimala temple, the LDF raised the issue of â€˜tactical tie-upâ€™ between the Welfare Party of India and the UDF and highlightedÂ State governmentâ€™s achievements during the campaign

title: Goa nightclub fire: Interpol issues Blue Notice against 2 owners
content: An Interpol colour-coded notice alerts all 196 member countries of the Lyon-based organisation about a member countryâ€™s request to find particular information

title: Electioneering ends on a high note in Palakkad
content: Sulthan Pet emerged as the focal point of the celebrations, where thousands converged and engaged in lively cultural shows, bike rallies, and spirited processions.

title: Chief of the Naval Staff embarks on official visit to Brazil
content: The visit, from December 09 to 12, is aimed at consolidating the robust and steadily expanding maritime partnership between the Indian Navy and the Brazilian Navy

title: Robots in classroom: Telanganaâ€™s ATCs to help students acquire Industry 4.0 skills
content: Deputy Chief Minister Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka, during a session at the summit, said the government is planning to increase the number of ATCs to 105 by setting up another 40 across the State

title: CBI registers loan fraud cases against Reliance ADA Group firms, searches premises of Anil Ambaniâ€™s son
content: Agency books RHFL and RCFL in major bank loan fraud probe and searches the Mumbai premises of Jai Anmol Ambani as part of its investigation

title: Congress leader slams Stateâ€™s silence on Seeds Bill 2025 as â€˜political surrenderâ€™
content: Bhargav says draft law strips States of powers, favours corporates and leaves farmers without protection; alleges government is complicit by refusing to oppose Centreâ€™s move

title: Adequate urea stocks available for Rabi season, says official
content: Agriculture Director says steady supplies have eased shortage concerns and instructs districts to maintain a three-week buffer while intensifying farmer awareness on balanced urea use

title: Clashes erupt in Vanchiyoor over alleged bogus voting during local body polls
content: BJP workers accuse transgender voters of bogus voting, prompting a confrontation with CPI(M) cadre. Incidents of violence also reported in Karumam and Nedumangad

title: Palakkad sets up 2,749 polling booths; Tamil ballot labels in 93 wards
content: Around 28.6 lakh voters will cast their ballots from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. on Wednesday. In six grama panchayats near Tamil Nadu, ballot labels will feature candidatesâ€™ names in Tamil, reflecting the regionâ€™s linguistic diversity.

title: Naidu seeks swift proposals for â‚¹40,000-cr Purvodaya plan to spur irrigation and rural growth
content: CM calls for major allocations to irrigation, horticulture, and infrastructure as he reviews key linkage projects and orders speedy execution across all regions of Andhra Pradesh

title: Mercury plunges to single digits in Ghat areas of Kerala
content: Mercury plunges to single digits in places such as Kundala dam on Monday night, where the lowest temperature of 7.5Â°C was recorded, Munnar 9.4Â°C, and Vattavada 9.7 Â°C

title: Canada unveils new 'Express Entry' category for doctors
content: a new Express Entry category will be created for foreign doctors with at least one year of recent Canadian work experience . invitations under the new stream will begin in early 2026 . the govt will also reserve 5,000 federal admission spaces for provinces and territories to nominate licensed physicians with job offers .

title: US visa chaos: Many H-1B interviews cancelled; social media vetting rule set to kick in
content: Lubna Kably is a senior editor, who focuses on various policies and legislation. In particular, she writes extensively on immigration and tax policies. The Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries for outbound students, job aspirants and employees. She also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities. Read More

title: â€˜Slop, rage bait': When language turns into warnings - what 2025 'Words of the Year' reveal about AI
content: 'words of the year' came from science, from art, from discovery . they named planets, ideas, emotions. they made language feel like progress . in 2025, the words made word feel like a warning .

title: 3 posers & 4 demands: Rahul stirs SIR storm in Lok Sabha; what he said on CJI, CCTVs
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." title: Women's Bracketology: How the Big Ten is shaping the field
